description: Numbers n such that there exist exactly 2 Abelian groups of order n, i.e. A000688(n) = 2.
comments: n belongs to this sequence iff exactly one prime in its factorization into prime powers has exponent 2 and all the other primes in the factorization have exponent 1, for example 60 = 2^2 * 3 * 5.Numbers n such that A046660(n)=1. - _Zak Seidov_, Nov 14 2012
links: Enrique PÃ©rez Herrero, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5000
Index entries for sequences related to groups
prog: (PARI) for(n=1,279,if(bigomega(n)-omega(n)==1,print1(n,",")))(PARI) is(n)=factorback(factor(n)[,2])==2 \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Sep 18 2015(Haskell)a060687 n = a060687_list !! (n-1)a060687_list = filter ((== 1) . a046660) [1..]-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Nov 29 2015
